meanings.definition: Muscles that extend or straighten a limb or joint.
meanings.sent1: The extensors in my arm help me reach for things on high shelves.
meanings.sent2: Physical therapists often focus on strengthening the extensors to improve mobility.
meanings.sent3: The extensors in my legs must be on vacation today; I can't seem to stand up straight!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the powerful extensors in a sprinter's legs, propelling her forward.
meanings.sent5: The extensors, like invisible strings, pulled his fingers back into a straight line.

meanings.definition: Devices or mechanisms that extend or stretch something.
meanings.sent1: The extensors on the table allowed it to be extended for more guests.
meanings.sent2: The extensors in the telescope help astronomers adjust the focus.
meanings.sent3: The extensors on the accordion were broken, so it couldn't be fully opened.
meanings.sent4: The extensors on the crane reached out like giant metal fingers to lift the heavy load.
meanings.sent5: With a click, the extensors on the recliner extended to provide maximum comfort.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that extends or lengthens something.
meanings.sent1: As a writer, she saw herself as an extensor of ideas and emotions.
meanings.sent2: The architect was the extensor of the client's vision, bringing it to life.
meanings.sent3: The gardener was the extensor of the plants' growth, nurturing them to flourish.
meanings.sent4: The teacher acted as an extensor of knowledge, guiding students to new understandings.
meanings.sent5: The artist was the extensor of beauty, capturing it on canvas for all to see.
